relation: Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
I've noticed that a lot of people dip snuff and chew tobacco here.
you're on your own with this one.
Food is not very good here. there are options, but the options are limited, although they are expanding menus every once in a while.
this varies from floor to floor, but generally it's not that loud/dirty.
some classes will be very difficult and painful, some will be easy. depends on what you take and what your major is.

This school is very quiet and not very diverse. Not much goes on here. Some would say it's boring, but I find it comfortable. there are places you can go to party on the weekends, yes, but if you're expecting an american pie-type school, you are mistaken.
pageTitle: Marietta College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {136270=4 sororities and 4 fraternities with a campus population of around 1400 students., 151824=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 48301=Every year we have Doo Dah Day, which is a campus-wide stress-relief fun day before finals in April. The college and students arrange activities like ultimate frisbee tournaments, mud volleyball tournaments, other competitions and rent blow-up bouncers of all kinds. The foodservice is an outdoor barbecue and everyone has a great time all day. The Mall is the main vein of the college - it is a brick walkway that used to be the continuation of Fifth Street. The college finally reached an accordance with the town to lay down brick and close it off to motorized vehicles. It is always a good place to meet people and a good point at which to rendezvous., 23721=Small class sizes and a demanding load of general education credits makes Marietta a college where an absence of work can not go undetected. Additionally, Marietta was called the Harvard of the mid-west in the Princeton Review 2011.}

textAfterTable: Brooke 10/16/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 6 out of 6 people found this review useful. 2 of 32 Categories Comments Great for these types of students It's great for almost all types of students. It is a very competitive school though, if your just going to school for fun it might be challenging. If you are someone who did have a lot of trouble in high school there are programs to help you though and lots of people attend them so you don't need to worry about feeling dumb for being tutored. Tips for prospective students Go on a overnight visit if you can, that's pretty much how I made my decision. Bang for the buck It's a little expensive but you get a lot here. Like free laundry! All events are free to students too. They offer students a lot. All campus is wi-fi. Am enjoying being here I love it here. The student body is so
